Specific flows for each statistical method

Luke W. Johnston

2018-07-05

Source: vignettes/specifics.Rmd
specifics.Rmd

This vignette goes over typical ‘constuction’ projects for each of the analysis designs. First, let’s load up mason!

library(mason)

T-tests

swiss %>% 
    design('t.test') %>% 
    add_settings() %>% 
    add_variables('yvars', c('Fertility', 'Agriculture')) %>% 
    add_variables('xvars', c('Examination', 'Education')) %>% 
    construct() %>% 
    scrub()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 12
#>   Yterms  Xterms estimate estimate1 estimate2 statistic  p.value parameter
#>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
#> 1 Agricu… Educa…     39.7      50.7      11.0     11.0  2.96e-16      62.0
#> 2 Agricu… Exami…     34.2      50.7      16.5      9.73 9.76e-14      57.2
#> 3 Fertil… Educa…     59.2      70.1      11.0     25.7  2.93e-42      86.3
#> 4 Fertil… Exami…     53.7      70.1      16.5     24.8  8.18e-39      78.2
#> # ... with 4 more variables: conf.low <dbl>, conf.high <dbl>,
#> #   method <chr>, alternative <chr>

Correlations

swiss %>% 
    design('cor') %>% 
    add_settings() %>% 
    add_variables('yvars', c('Fertility', 'Agriculture')) %>% 
    add_variables('xvars', c('Examination', 'Education')) %>% 
    construct() %>% 
    scrub()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   Vars1       Vars2       Correlations
#>   <chr>       <chr>              <dbl>
#> 1 Examination Fertility         -0.646
#> 2 Education   Fertility         -0.664
#> 3 Examination Agriculture       -0.687
#> 4 Education   Agriculture       -0.640

Linear regression

swiss %>% 
    design('glm') %>% 
    add_settings() %>% 
    add_variables('yvars', c('Fertility', 'Agriculture')) %>% 
    add_variables('xvars', c('Examination', 'Education')) %>% 
    add_variables('covariates', 'Catholic') %>% 
    construct() %>% 
    scrub()
#> # A tibble: 12 x 10
#>    Yterms   Xterms   term   estimate std.error statistic  p.value conf.low
#>    <chr>    <chr>    <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 Agricul… Educati… (Inte…  5.91e+1    4.62     12.8    2.09e-16  50.0   
#>  2 Agricul… Educati… <-Xte… -1.40e+0    0.254    -5.50   1.81e- 6  -1.90  
#>  3 Agricul… Educati… Catho…  1.69e-1    0.0586    2.88   6.09e- 3   0.0540
#>  4 Agricul… Examina… (Inte…  8.23e+1    8.72      9.44   3.79e-12  65.2   
#>  5 Agricul… Examina… <-Xte… -1.94e+0    0.381    -5.08   7.29e- 6  -2.68  
#>  6 Agricul… Examina… Catho…  6.39e-3    0.0728    0.0877 9.30e- 1  -0.136 
#>  7 Fertili… Educati… (Inte…  7.42e+1    2.35     31.6    7.35e-32  69.6   
#>  8 Fertili… Educati… <-Xte… -7.88e-1    0.129    -6.10   2.43e- 7  -1.04  
#>  9 Fertili… Educati… Catho…  1.11e-1    0.0298    3.72   5.60e- 4   0.0525
#> 10 Fertili… Examina… (Inte…  8.30e+1    4.98     16.7    1.21e-20  73.3   
#> 11 Fertili… Examina… <-Xte… -8.86e-1    0.217    -4.08   1.88e- 4  -1.31  
#> 12 Fertili… Examina… Catho…  4.18e-2    0.0416    1.01   3.20e- 1  -0.0397
#> # ... with 2 more variables: conf.high <dbl>, sample.size <int>

Generalized estimating equations

data.frame(state.x77, state.region) %>% 
    design('gee') %>% 
    add_settings(cluster.id = 'state.region') %>% 
    add_variables('yvars', c('Income', 'Frost')) %>% 
    add_variables('xvars', c('Population', 'Murder')) %>% 
    add_variables('covariates', c('Life.Exp', 'Area')) %>% 
    add_variables('interaction', 'Area') %>% 
    construct() %>% 
    add_variables('xvars', c('Illiteracy')) %>%
    construct() %>%
    scrub()
#> Loading required namespace: geepack
#> xvars already exists in the specs, but will be replaced.
#> # A tibble: 30 x 12
#>    Yterms Xterms   term     estimate std.error statistic  p.value conf.low
#>    <chr>  <chr>    <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#>  1 Frost  Murder   (Interc…  1.43e+3   4.66e+2    9.34   2.24e- 3  5.12e+2
#>  2 Frost  Murder   <-Xterm  -1.30e+1   1.90e+0   46.9    7.33e-12 -1.67e+1
#>  3 Frost  Murder   Life.Exp -1.74e+1   6.51e+0    7.18   7.37e- 3 -3.02e+1
#>  4 Frost  Murder   Area      1.84e-4   3.07e-4    0.357  5.50e- 1 -4.19e-4
#>  5 Frost  Murder   <-Xterm… -4.35e-6   2.75e-5    0.0251 8.74e- 1 -5.82e-5
#>  6 Frost  Populat… (Interc… -7.26e+2   4.00e+2    3.30   6.92e- 2 -1.51e+3
#>  7 Frost  Populat… <-Xterm   2.14e-4   1.71e-3    0.0157 9.00e- 1 -3.13e-3
#>  8 Frost  Populat… Life.Exp  1.17e+1   5.66e+0    4.28   3.85e- 2  6.19e-1
#>  9 Frost  Populat… Area      1.49e-4   4.71e-5   10.1    1.51e- 3  5.71e-5
#> 10 Frost  Populat… <-Xterm… -3.67e-8   7.58e-9   23.5    1.23e- 6 -5.16e-8
#> # ... with 20 more rows, and 4 more variables: conf.high <dbl>,
#> #   sample.total <int>, sample.max <int>, sample.min <int>
